isis.stitle: TSI 92-03-03 - Wear Limits For Rear Suspension Torque Leaf Bushings

subjectgroup.subject: Wear Limits For Rear Suspension Torque Leaf Bushings

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to all vehicles equipped with Vari-Rate rear suspension.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: The following procedures may be used to determine when Vari-Rate rear suspension torque leaf bushing service is required.

note.para: The following bushing wear check should be made PRIOR to lubrication.

step1.para: Insert a 12 inch to 16 inch bar between the spring bracket rebound pin and the torque leaf spring eye. Observe movement of the torque leaf spring eye while pushing up and down on the outer end of the bar. If movement of the torque leaf spring eye at the shackle pin appears to be more than 1/8 inch, go to step 2.
It should be noted that a bar of greater length than 16 inches could possibly exert undue force causing the spring, spring bracket and/or spring shackle pin to be deformed.

The only accurate measurement of bushing wear requires removing the spring shackle pin ( Figure 1), measuring the outside diameter of the pin and the inside diameter of the spring eye bushing ( Figure 1). The difference between the two measurements is the amount of clearance between the spring eye bushing and the spring shackle pin. If a measurement of .007 to .012 is noted, the bushing is new. A measurement of .080 to .090 indicates that the bushing should be replaced during the next vehicle service interval; if the measurement is .120 or more, the bushing should be replaced immediately.
